title: Artificial intelligence could be as dangerous as 'pandemics or nuclear war' according to industry leaders
description: A new petition is warning of the existential risks posed by artificial intelligence. In the middle of a debate on the regulation of the sector, some see it as a diversion.

title: South Africa faces legal bid to force Putin's arrest  ahead of BRICS summit
description: BRICS is a bloc of emerging economies made up of countries including China and Russia. South Africa has refused to condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine which has largely isolated Moscow on the international stage.

title: US top diplomat Blinken says 'the time is now' for Sweden to join NATO
description: Two days after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan won a new term, US Secretary of State Antony blinken said the US urged 'both Turkey and Hungary to ratify the accession as quickly as possible'.

title: 'Succession' creator Jesse Armstrong: 'This show is not the sort of piece of work that has one single message'
description: With the final episode of the series' final season having just aired, its creator analyzes the reasons behind its success with the public and critics alike.

title: Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes to begin 11-year sentence for notorious blood-testing hoax
description: Holmes raised nearly $1 billion for her company Theranos, which she claimed would revolutionize health care. Her blood-testing company turned out to be a fraud.

title: Attacks against Palme d'Or winner misconstruct how French films are funded
description: MPs criticized director Justine Triet's acceptance speech at the Cannes film festival, arguing that her film was largely financed with public funds. But this is an oversimplified interpretation of the French film financing system.

title: Macron contradicts French PM Borne over her comments on far right's 'dangerous ideology'
description: Speaking at a cabinet meeting, the French president said 'You will not be able to make millions of French people who voted for the far right believe that they are fascists.'

title: Erdogan faces the risk of a major currency crisis in Turkey
description: Rampant inflation, currency devaluation, rising current account deficits and investor flight mark the country's economic turmoil.

title: Pornography: 'Adults believe teenagers take what they see at face value. They don't'
description: According to a study published last week by a French watchdog, 2.3 million minors in France accessed x-rated websites in 2022, an increase of 36% in five years. Diane Saint-Réquier, a sexual health educator, urges the need for a dialogue with minors.

title: Mark Bryant, the American keeping count of mass shootings
description: With his organization, the Gun Violence Archive, he has taken upon himself the task of recording all firearm-related tragedies in the United States. Despite being a gun enthusiast himself, he nevertheless supports improved regulation.

title: France's plan to tackle welfare fraud
description: The government on Tuesday unveiled a series of measures to combat this multi-faceted fraud. This follows recently announced proposals to combat tax fraud.

title: How much should oil companies pay to compensate for their climate damage?
description: A study published in May 2023 attempts to estimate the reparations that the biggest fossil fuel producers should pay. The answer is over $200 billion every year for 25 years.

title: Paris 2024: What we know about the selection process for Olympic torchbearers
description: 11,000 people will support swimmers Laure and Florent Manaudou, para-athletes Mona Francis and Dimitri Pavadé, the torch relay 'super-ambassadors.' The route will be revealed on June 23.

title: Russia issues arrest warrant for US Senator Lindsey Graham
description: Russia’s Interior Ministry has issued an arrest warrant for the top Republican after he praised US military aid to Ukraine as 'the best money we’ve ever spent.'

title: Middle East hails Erdogan's victory as guarantee of regional status quo
description: The Turkish president received congratulatory messages from his old allies and protégés, such as Qatar and the Islamist movement Hamas, and from Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Israel, countries with which relations have long been chaotic.

title: Greek elections: Why Kyriakos Mitsotakis and his right-wing party have succeeded
description: On May 21, Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis won almost 41% of the vote in the parliamentary elections.

title: French Palme d'Or winner provokes controversy with speech criticizing state for 'commercializing culture'
description: Supported by the left, Justine Triet has been attacked for her 'ingratitude' by Macron's party and the right.

title: Spanish prime minister calls early election and dissolves Parliament
description: The Spanish Socialist Workers' Party performed poorly in local elections on Sunday. The legislative elections scheduled for December have been brought forward to July 23.

title: Moscow targeted by drone attack, no casualties
description: The Russian capital's mayor spoke of "minor" damage to buildings but reported no casualties.

title: Southwestern French city's industrial heritage rekindled by war in Ukraine
description: After three takeovers in five years, the Forges de Tarbes could benefit from the global demand for shells and emerge from its slump. But the industrial challenge before it is immense.

title: The Russian pensioners manipulated into setting military offices on fire
description: The victims of various kinds of scams, the pensioners are being forced by criminal networks – Ukrainian, according to the country's authorities – into attacking targets on Russian territory.

title: Miami defeats Boston and goes to the NBA Finals
description: The Miami Heat won game 7 of the Eastern Conference and beat the Boston Celtics 103-84, on Monday.

title: El Salvador: At least 153 people arrested under special powers have died in prisons
description: The deaths were the result of torture, and systematic and serious injuries, according to a report released Monday by the human rights group Cristosal.

title: China's Shenzhou-16 mission takes off bound for the space station
description: Plans for "space dream" have been put into overdrive under President Xi Jinping. China is planning to build a lunar base.

title: Lula and Maduro launch 'new era' in Brazil-Venezuela ties
description: Considered a pariah in some quarters for his socialist government's alleged human-rights violations, Nicolas Maduro was welcomed by an honor guard at the presidential palace in Brasilia.

title: North Korea says it will launch its first military spy satellite
description: On Tuesday, Pyongyang described such capacities as crucial for monitoring the United States' "reckless" military exercises with rival South Korea.

title: Kosovo: Over 30 peacekeepers injured in clashes with Serb protesters
description: Kosovo police said 'organized' demonstrators rallied in northern Kosovo towns, home to many ethnic Serbs who reject Kosovo's independence from Serbia.

title: Erdogan's re-election: Self-serving congratulations from Western leaders
description: Paris, Washington and Brussels welcomed the Turkish president's victory, in the hope of reviving their relations with Ankara, which have been severely damaged in recent years. The main issue at stake is Sweden's accession to NATO, blocked by Turkey.
